title: [Self-Directed] Mixed Reality Simulation-Based Program to Enhance Middle School Science Pre-Service Teachers' Classroom Management Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic science curriculum content and foundational lesson design concepts
context.additional_context: Mixed-reality-based teacher training program in BYOD environments. Customized training where pre-service teachers virtually experience real classroom situations to acquire effective class management skills

learning_goals: In a mixed-reality simulation environment, learners can apply personalized instruction strategies based on student types (engagement levels, proficiency, etc.) with over 80% accuracy.

For unpredictable situations in science classes (e.g., conceptual misunderstandings, experimental errors), learners can execute at least three effective intervention techniques based on Caoâ€™s Teacher Response Model (2022).

Through interaction with digital avatars, learners can explain inclusive instructional design principles considering learner diversity (learning disabilities, cultural backgrounds, etc.) in four or more distinct stages.

resources: UDL (Universal Design for Learning) implementation guidelines

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
